faqItems.a: 1024 is used because it is 2^10 (power of two), which corresponds to the binary number system used in computers.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to convert petabytes and exabytes?
faqItems.a: In the current version, the converter supports B, KB, MB, GB and TB. Petabytes and exabytes are planned to be added in future updates.

faqItems.q: How to convert file size?
faqItems.a: The converter is suitable for converting file sizes. Enter the size in one unit and select the desired unit to convert.

faqItems.q: Does the converter support negative data values?
faqItems.a: No, data volume is always a positive value. The converter does not support negative numbers.

faqItems.q: What is the maximum amount of data that can be converted?
faqItems.a: The converter can work with any values, limited only by JavaScript capabilities.

faqItems.q: Can the converter be used on mobile devices?
faqItems.a: Yes, the converter is fully adapted for mobile devices and works on all platforms: iOS, Android, Windows, macOS.

faqItems.q: Is the data converter free?
faqItems.a: Yes, the converter is completely free and available without registration. You can use it anytime.

faqItems.q: Do I need an Internet connection for the converter to work?
faqItems.a: Yes, an internet connection is required to use the online converter. All calculations are performed in the browser.

faqItems.q: How to save the result of data conversion?
faqItems.a: The result can be copied to the clipboard or taken a screenshot. You can also record the result manually.

faqItems.q: Is a converter used in IT?
faqItems.a: Yes, the converter is widely used in IT to transfer volumes of data, memory, disks and storage between different units.

faqItems.q: Is the converter suitable for system administrators?
faqItems.a: Yes, the converter is ideal for system administrators to convert disk, memory and storage volumes.

faqItems.q: How to convert disk or memory capacity?
faqItems.a: The converter is suitable for converting disk and memory capacity. Enter the volume in one unit and select the desired unit.

faqItems.q: What is a byte?
faqItems.a: A byte (B) is the basic unit of data in computer science. 1 byte = 8 bits. This is the minimum addressable unit of information.

faqItems.q: What is the difference between KB and KiB?
faqItems.a: KB (kilobyte) = 1024 bytes (binary unit), KiB (kibibyte) = 1024 bytes (official binary unit). Our converter uses KB = 1024 bytes.

faqItems.q: How fast is the data converter?
faqItems.a: The converter works instantly. Calculations are performed in real time as values â€‹â€‹are entered.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to convert very large amounts of data?
faqItems.a: Yes, the converter can work with any values, including very large volumes (petabytes, exabytes, etc.).

faqItems.q: Which unit is more accurate: byte or kilobyte?
faqItems.a: Both units are equally accurate, they just have different scales. A byte is useful for small data, a kilobyte is useful for files.

faqItems.q: Why do disk manufacturers use 1000 and not 1024?
faqItems.a: Manufacturers use 1000 for marketing purposes (10-base system). The actual disk capacity used is 1024 (2-base system).

faqItems.q: Is the converter used in programming?
faqItems.a: Yes, the converter is used in programming to calculate the amount of data, memory and buffers in various units of measurement.

faqItems.q: How does reverse conversion work?
faqItems.a: The converter supports two-way conversion: you can convert from one unit to another, and vice versa, simply by swapping the units.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to use the converter to calculate the volume of Internet traffic?
faqItems.a: Yes, the converter is ideal for converting Internet traffic volumes between different units of measurement.

faqItems.q: How to convert file size from operating system?
faqItems.a: The operating system displays the file size in one of the units (KB, MB, GB). Enter this value and select the desired unit to convert.
